Topic.Title: No URL's in yahoo messages. For crying out loud, some people like to post sources

Message.Msg: You can post your source - just without a click - on URL (if they ever get the system to work). The serial message board spammers use click-on URL's to scam Yahoo users. Yahoo seems completely unable to stop issuing unlimed ID's to these scammers or to block their posts (through immediate deletion based on content, for examplel) so they take the easy way out of blocking click-on URL's.

Topic.Title: Yahoo book value is $10.50 not including $15B ($12.80/share) investment return from Alibaba.

Message.Msg: But not unrealized investment return, correct? Yahoo invested in Alibaba for $1B six years ago but now this investment worth $14B - 15B (based on Alibaba's buy back plan), so it's still showing $1B in Yahoo's book. That's why this stock is under valued.
We are not talking about Nigerian scammers here. We are talking about message board posts with teaser headlines leading to scam URL's selling phony stock market letters, videos, etc.
HUGE STRETCH! It can hit 20 ONLY if someone offers to buy them at 22. Now THAT'S a big stretch.
